intro: Eritrichium plebeium, commonly known as the common erithrion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in early spring, usually from March to May. Its leaves are basal, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is part of the Papaveraceae family, known for its showy, often brightly colored flowers.
